entry.title: Evan Buckley Off-Shift Adventures
entry.summary:
Author: Spacers24

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,628Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 1,002

Summary: After over-hearing the 118 saying he should get a life outside of the firehouse, Buck swears that he will make a life for his own outside the firehouse and it's crew. His idea to achieve that is trying out activity he can do during his free time. He never expected that this would lead to him making some new friends. And one things for sure, his new friends and routine is sure to never leave his life boring ever again.

entry.title: Chains are meant to break

Author: Thehouseknight

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,501Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 30

Summary: “Where is your plus one?” Helena asked, looking around. “Buck,” Eddie replied. “Buck?” “Yes,” Buck said. “I’m Eddie’s plus one.” Buck's fingers intertwined with Eddie’s fingers, and he looked at her with a tense gaze. “I’m Eddie’s boyfriend.”--------Or: Eddie and Buck travel to El Paso for Abuela's birthday celebration. entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 379,598Chapters: 46/?Kudos: 59

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.summary:
Author: thispieisworthit (lils_in_wonderland)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,348Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 10

Summary: Eddie turns onto his side and then back onto his stomach. He buries his head into the pillow and groans. What's the saying? Once is happenstance, twice is coincidence, and well, somewhere in the realm of eight times is enemy action. In this case, Eddie is battling telepathic, friendship-destroying enemies semi-regularly. -- Or, Eddie has wet dreams for the first time in two decades, Buck isn't so thrilled with his new house, and they just can't stop fighting. Author: edmundodiazjr

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 873Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Summary: Both Buck and Eddie had been beaten, dragged through stages that stripped them down to bone and fear. Buck had survived two rounds already, watching opponents—friends—die one by one.Eddie had endured the same nightmare, watching numbers rise on the scoreboard only for a competitor to fall short and be executed. Over and over. Until suddenly, it was just the two of them left.The last participants.Eddie had tried to refuse. Tried to argue. Tried to throw the match before it even began—because how was he supposed to sing while knowing the man he’d started to fall for might die because of a number? But the aliens didn’t care. They beat him until he couldn’t stand straight, but still breathing meant he still had to perform.So it came down to this: Buck or Eddie.OR; Alien Stage AU of BUDDIE

entry.title: even if there's nothing else
entry.summary:
Author: rizcriz

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,373Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 241

Summary: He doesn’t want to go. There’s so much here for him—so much to fight for, but he’s been fighting for so long, and there’s only so much he can do when he’s pinned and bleeding steadily. There’s not much to fight anymore except God, and God’s seemingly made a choice. And, just as Buck was finally starting to understand, too. Sniffing, he asks, voice cracking, “Eddie?” He’s scared. There’ve been so many close calls, but not quite as close as this, and he’s terrified, but there’s too much to say. Too much on the line. He can’t let the fear keep him quiet anymore. He’s wasted so much time on being afraid, and now he’s run out, and he just— He needs Eddie to know. -- or, Buck's dying.

entry.title: Whispers in the Barracks
entry.summary:
Author: MissP20

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,883Chapters: 2/7Kudos: 1

Summary: In a wartime military camp, companions—people of all genders—are stripped of freedom and forced into sexual servitude. Buck arrives as one of them, his defiance quickly crushed by the cruel system. Eddie, a soldier bound by duty, has never questioned the morality of the camp—until Buck awakens something in him: compassion, desire, and a dangerous, forbidden connection. Amid stolen moments and constant danger, their secret bond grows—but in a world built on power and cruelty, love comes at a cost, and survival may demand the ultimate sacrifice.

entry.title: Cry me a cockroach
entry.summary:
Author: shelfthe_reader

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,257Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 35

Summary: “I can’t decide if this is more for you or for me,” Buck said, rereading the printed off email. Eddie shrugged. “It was pretty therapeutic.” It was their first Christmas as a couple, and Eddie decided that he needed to go all out. The gift needed to be one of a kind. Special. Something that he’d never given Buck before.   It's Buck and Eddie's first Christmas together as a couple, and Eddie has no idea what to get his boyfriend. Apparently, all it takes is an unfortunate encounter and a teenage son to find the right gift.

entry.title: Can't Remember To Forget You
entry.summary:
Author: Coffeecrusadeclub

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,462Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 24

Summary: "Eddie stared at the ceiling of his hotel room, trying to convince himself he was making the right choice. Not that now was a good time to second guess that.His fiancée was in a different room two floors above him with her bridesmaids. Buck, his best friend, was in the next room of their shared two bedroom suite, having taken the pull out couch so Chris could have his own space as well.Eddie thought about Buck, he thought about how much more distant they’d gotten. He was surprised Buck had agreed to be a groomsman. Eddie didn’t deserve his support, not after what he’d done.Eddie could still picture it, the night he’d ruined it all. The night he destroyed everything, all because he was a coward" oor Eddie rejects Buck because he's not ready to leave his closet & winds up engaged to a woman, who he abandons the morning of the wedding because he's running away with Buck.

entry.title: The crashes are heaven for a sinner released
entry.summary:
Author: milowren

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,135Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 185

Summary: Before Eddie can think of any more excuses, Buck bursts back through the surface of the water with Eddie’s body in his arms. Eddie looks down at himself, still kneeling on the dock, and then at what is unmistakably also him in the water. Buck sucks in a great gasp of air, but the Eddie in the water doesn’t. His head slumps limp onto Buck’s shoulder, and the puzzle pieces of the last few minutes suddenly fall into place. Finding himself back on the dock with no memory of how he got there. Buck unable to see or hear him. Eddie’s hand passing right through him. Oh. He didn’t make it out of the water. He drowned.***After an injury on a call, Eddie finds himself something he never expected to be... A ghost.

entry.title: The Home We Build
entry.summary:
Author: happinesscomeswithus

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,397Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 5

Summary: After everything — the calls, the chaos, the long nights and close calls — Buck and Eddie finally get the one thing they’ve never had: peace. Newly engaged and living in the house they chose together, they’re building a life defined not by emergencies, but by morning muffins, garden plans, FaceTime with family, and the quiet love that grows in the in-between. For Eddie, it’s a slow unraveling of old expectations — exploring softness, femininity, and what it means to be fully seen.This is a story of healing, queerness, domesticity, found family, and the tender joy of a life you don’t have to brace yourself against. No firestorms. No cliffhangers. Just a steady heartbeat of home.

Summary: Rewritten starting at the competition scene with Tommy and Buck.Buck stands up for himself and Eddie against Tommy. entry.title: Unconditional Love
entry.summary:
Author: villayuly1987

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,981Chapters: 26/?Kudos: 32

Summary: Evan is Bobby’s biological son from a previous marriage; Athena is his stepmother)This story is set six months after a major virus exposure. Eddie has returned home from Texas to help out Chimney, who is temporarily stepping in as captain of the 118 firehouse while the actual captain, Bobby, is in a medically induced coma fighting the virus.During the six months apart, Eddie and Evan grew incredibly close, leading to a secret relationship between them. Evan is struggling significantly with his father's condition, spending almost all his time at the hospital, barely sleeping or eating. Eddie is actively trying to take care of him, even having to drag Evan out of the hospital to rest.

entry.title: Love Me Anyway
entry.summary:
Author: gryff_grace

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 53,086Chapters: 7/10Kudos: 118

Summary: Moving slowly, Buck sits up in bed. Groans. Reaches the heel of his hands to press tenderly against his eyes. Inhales, taking in a deep breath. Exhales. Finally, he’s able to open his eyes, and he draws back his hands. Then, he realizes. These are not his hands. Buck stares, flexing out his fingers - not his fingers. They’re long, slender, a little dainty. The index and middle fingers are home to delicate gold rings. The nails are press-ons, colored dark maroon, and what the actual fuck. A sound comes from his mouth - not his mouth - and it’s a sweet, womanly squeak. Oh god oh god oh god. * Or - the fic where Buck is in love with Eddie, wakes up every day in a different body, and has no idea what to do about either.

entry.title: Drag Path
entry.summary:
Author: sleeptokensdaredevil

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 46,703Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 17

Summary: The heat of the fire was already starting to make her sweat, even through the protection of the turnout gear. Three other firefighters rushed past, running back into the blazing warehouse. She heard another firefighter yelling that there were at least twenty people still inside, and fear washed over her body as she thought about how the hell everyone was going to get out in time. Buck threw on his helmet and oxygen tank quickly as her eyes followed his every move, his legs making long strides towards the burning building. “Cora!” The woman’s head whipped towards Bobby, who was staring back, a reassuring smile on his face as she grabbed the rest of her gear and threw it on, rushing into the building behind him.   “I need a little help here.” The helmet on her head shifted a little as she turned the direction the voice had come from, not knowing who the hell was speaking or if they were even talking to her. The voice sounded deep, obvious that it was a man, and it sounded like he was struggling. She stopped in her tracks when she noticed the girl no older than ten being carried by a man in a full black outfit, his eyes covered by a piece of cloth. “You have got to be fucking kidding me.”
